newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dickson sees double-digit growth 97/98.
newsitem.headline: Dickson sees double-digit growth 97/98.

text.p: Hong Kong-based upmarket retailer Dickson Concepts (International) Ltd said on Monday it expected to achieve double-digit profits growth in the year ending March 31, 1998.

"All subsidiaries around the world operating are profitably, and the group is confident of achieving double digit profits growth during the current financial year," chairman Dickson Poon told a news conference.

The group posted a 240.9 percent surge in net profit to HK$1.35 billion for the year to March 31, 1997, boosted by a HK$901.14 million exceptional gain from the flotation of units Harvey Nichols Group Plc and S.T. Dupont.
Operating profit grew 23 percent to HK$635 million during the fiscal year.
Poon said the group had net cash of about HK$1.3 billion.
He said he expected Harvey Nichols, which posted a 39.9 percent growth in profit to 8.18 million sterling for the last fiscal year, to sustain its net profit growth rate.
"The group is confident that Harvey Nichols will sustain its current rate of growth in bottom line," he said.
"Harvey Nichols continues to seek additional sites in the United Kingdom which may be suitable for retail stores or stand-alone restaurants," he said.

Poon said he expected the number of Dickson retail outlets to increase to more than 330 worldwide this year with the scheduled opening of at least 70 outlets in 1997 to add to an existing network of over 270 outlets.
"The group is at an advanced stage of negotiations with respect to several investment opportunities in different parts of the world," he said, without elaborating.
